TopicTitle: Fastest Plane under 1.000m. [WE HAVE REACHED MACH 5!, Tidus Klein at 1,714 m/s]

Articles.Content:
My best attempt. I'm sure if I burned off some fuel I'd squeeze out a lil more - non-FAR Speed 362.1m/s

BTW, couple of mod parts you don't have listed and if you feel the need to disqualify, do so. But, they have no effect on performance (other than drag). Firespitter wing engine mounts (to make this monstrosity possible) and Multi-wheels landing gear because I can NEVER get B9 gear to go straight.

And Jeb had a blast, he says thanks.

really like you design, is it possible to get the craft file?`

@fengist

really like you design, is it possible to get the craft file?`

@fengist

Ummm crap. Sorry, I didn't even bother to save it. It's basically B9 stuff. The only real 'trick' to it was I had to add a fuselage in between the tail and the fuel tank (it's up front) in order to stretch it out a bit. With all those engines on the wing the center of mass was WAY back and I needed those two winglets up front to land it. That's also why those two vertical rudders have stock wings on top of them, to move the center of lift back so I could mount the winglets. The main wing is as far back as it would go. Other than that, which took a few tries to get right, it's pretty easy to build.

Here's a shot of one of the previous versions with a wider but single wing section. A tad faster but no winglets up front. You may also notice some air brakes on it. It was impossible to land, it would nose up hard at low speeds and I was trying to fix that.

Hope this gives you some ideas on where to start.

What FAR vershion are you running as i only get 600M/s and it Spins out at a Pin drop

I have some B9 SABRE "planes" that can reach 1.1 km/s under 1000 meters. Maybe I could use 4 stock jets to make a "pplans (missile) that performs similarly well. Problem is what intake to use since a single pair of radials or a circus intake generate way too much drag and give more are than necessary.

What FAR vershion are you running as i only get 600M/s and it Spins out at a Pin drop

With one vertical stabilizer it is pretty easy to flip out on the horizontal axis. For pitch you have to adjust your control surfaces and engine gimbal on the F119 to not pitch so hard. If you have all 3 on gimbal and default 20 degree deflection yes it will flip out simply because the angle of attack is too high. otherwise it is pretty stable with aerodynamic centre quite far behind centre of mass as it should be.

With the high pitch high thrust F119 engines it's quite easy to recover from stalls, although the hyper sensitive pitch and small wings makes landing difficult.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/ferram-aerospace-research/
